intro: Meconopsis barbiseta, commonly known as the beard-tongued poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soil and full sun. Meconopsis barbiseta has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are often surrounded by bracts that resemble a beard, giving it its common name. It is a perennial plant that blooms in late spring to early summer.
